revised_title: Effects of Lightning on Buildings and People in Essex-Street, 1764
tldr: In 1764, a letter from Thomas Lawrence described the effects of a lightning strike on buildings and people in Essex Street. The lightning caused significant damage to chimneys, windows, and roofs, as well as strange sensations in some individuals. This event highlights the power of lightning and its potential dangers.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Natural Disasters
